intro: Scorzonera tenax, commonly known as the common scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features a robust, tuberous root system that can grow up to 30 cm in length, which is often used in traditional medicine. The plant has basal leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in a fine, hairy coating. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive dark center, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Scorzonera tenax thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands.
